case_body_condition: Not recognizable - Near complete or complete skeleton
case_address_found_1: Upper No Name Creek area (Flat tops) White River National Forest
case_circumstances: On September 9, 2004, skeletal remains of a male were found on the Flattops at the upper No Name creek area in a campsite. The remains as well as the campsite artifacts were collected. The deceased had high quality dental work done in the past. Possible back injury prior to death and may have spinal problems.
fingerprints: Fingerprint information is currently not available
case_clothing_on_body: Black belt with long underwear fragments, pair of blue wool socks with duct tape around toes,
case_footwear: Brown and black Timberland hiking boots (size 9 M)
case_jewelry: Wrist watch with black band, yellow colored border, Roman numerals for numbers
case_eyewear:
Pair of thin rimmed sunglasses (both lenses intact ) 
Pair of thin rimmed reading glasses (both lenses intact) purple arms
case_other_items_with_body: Several items were collected from the campsite including: fragments of sleeping cushion, blue backpack, brown sleeping bag, black Jansport backpack, blue hair brush, fingernail clippers, tweezers, package of razor blades, cash, butane stove with two fuel cans, sweetwater water-filtration kit, tent repair kit, two green plastic military-style canteens, compass, aluminum cooking pot, spoon, two National Geographic moisture-proof trail maps of Flat Tops area, "4 in 1" Radio Shack game, pocket sized Battleship, binoculars, 20 packs of Camel unfiltered cigarettes, eight multi-colored butane lighters, a bell, pepper spray, and green spiral notebook with hand-drawn depicting of a heart with figures inside. The first page of the notebook is addressed to "Lib").
dental: Dental information / charting is available and entered
documents: There are currently no documents available for this case.
